abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory, with
            a likely sustainability, although institutional development
            impacts were only modest. Several lessons are drawn from the
            project experience. The program could not have proceeded
            without a medium-term vision, and political commitment at
            the highest level of state management, a commitment
            essential to coordinate the actions of different sectors
            affected by the various reforms, as well as in supporting
            the debate in the state congress, with unions and other
            stakeholders. Nonetheless, the medium- and long-term process
            of reform, and fiscal discipline call for longer periods of
            program implementation, to assure fiscal discipline, and
            resolve indebtedness, in view of uncertainties, and elements
            outside the control of the state government, possibly
            through a programmatic type of support. Moreover, project
            preparation in electoral years require close involvement,
            and endorsement of outgoing. and incoming administrations,
            as demonstrated by this operation, which helped assure
            macroeconomic stability at a time of critical political
            transition, and helped avoid a repetition of a recurrent
            "end-of-sexenio" crisis. Finally, evidence of
            compliance with public finance targets should be based on
            audited, official data, since differences observed between
            preliminary fiscal data and the final "Cuenta
            P�blica", for which the executive branch is accountable
            to Congress, are of a magnitude that call into question the
            reliability of preliminary figures; rather, figures from
            audited reports, including the annually presented Cuenta
            P�blica, (instead of preliminary ones) should be used as
            evidence of fiscal performance. In view of the comprehensive
            nature of fiscal adjustment programs, an effective
            coordination proved essential for timely program
            implementation, and supervision.
